intro: Carum setaceum var. borgatense, commonly known as the Borgatensky carrot grass, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant features finely divided, feathery leaves that give it a delicate appearance, and it produces small, white or greenish flowers in umbels. It is often found in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its botanical characteristics make it a subject of interest in both horticulture and ecological studies.
